page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT:Cont
page.content: Sales representative, computer programmer, carpet fitter, coroner, waiter, draughtsman were typical. Almost half of the mothers worked and half of their children admitted to some form of part-time job. Only 7 of the 32 fathers or mothers parents lived in the D-Block:- 20 in Norfolk.The overwhelming majority lived far away: Ireland, Scotland, Lancashire, Essex, London, Australia, Italy, Notttingham, Dunstable, Birmingham, Southampton, Leyton, Gloucester, Purley and Coventry. Only two out of the 32 children questioned were born in the D-Block and only 15 in Norfolk. The rest came from as widespread an area as their parents. Only 5% of earning parents worked in the D-Block. Although 36% travelled five miles or less to work, 29%
